ratings.comment: Lectures at students for over an hour and complains that we aren't engaged. Gives harsh and unhelpful feedback. Doesn't put any words on the slides so you must pay attention. Exams/assignments are not all that bad, though.
I didn't receive any feedback on my final project. Also, many of  the readings she assigns are quite dated.

She presented the material in lectures with a limited amount of slides and no note help, so pay attention. Doing the readings didn't help too much. Lectures were more than often dry and boring, and grading for the exams and papers were done by a TA grader that came across a tad too harsh. Not a class I would strongly recommend.
Class material was overall presented in an unclear way with little organization.  If you pay attention in class and spend sometime studying the class is not too hard.

Do NOT take this class. Grading is ridiculous - the professor doesn't even grade it herself! Assignments are impossible - you do what they ask of you and yet somehow expect you to answer things that weren't even in the directions. Prof. Chopra is nice, but that doesn't make up for the poor quality of the grading.

Prof. Chopra is a very nice lady, but the course material is presented in a confusing way. She doesn't grade exams herself, instead had a TA who did it -- who graded harshly, in my opinion. Prof. Chopra is very helpful and communicates wonderfully through email, but she should work on grading things herself.

Meh.  The TA graded all of our assignments and she was on a mega power trip.  Prof. Chopra was certainly decent, though the material was presented in a confusing order.  Movie clips were highly appreciated.
